    Methods

    (async) apiCallAsync(method, module, action, obj, params, skipDataCheck) → {Promise.<*>}

    The one and only true function to interact with the api!

    Source:
    • main.js, line 371
    Parameters:
    Name Type Default Description
    method String

    Any http request method
    module String

    The module to use
    action String

    The action to preform
    obj Object

    The request body to send
    params Object

    Optionally any url parameters
    skipDataCheck Boolean false

    Skips certain checks
    Throws:

    errors

    Type
    Error | TypeError | *
    Returns:
    Type:
    Promise.<*>
    Example
    // Returns all events from the company with id 1 using async/await
const response = await apiCallAsync("POST", "event", "read", {companyID: "1"}, {extraParam: "hello"});

// Returns all events from the company with id 1 using promises
apiCallAsync("POST", "event", "read", {companyID: "1"}).then((response) => {
    // Do something with the response
}).catch((error) => {
    // Handle errors
});

    (async) beforeLogin(captcha, type) → {Promise.<void>}

    Check for login attempts and captcha before logging in

    Source:
    • main.js, line 435
    Parameters:
    Name Type Description
    captcha String

    The captcha code
    type String
    Throws:

    errors

    Type
    Error | *
    Returns:
    Type:
    Promise.<void>
    Example
    // Executes beforeLogin when submitting the forum
$("#loginForm").submit(async () => {
    // Using async/await
    try {
        await beforeLogin("sajdnj38hiusans=-2-osd9n");
    } catch (error) {
        handleException(error);
    }

    // Using promises (No .then() is needed because the promise resolves in void meaning nothing)
    beforeLogin("sajdnj38hiusans=-2-osd9n")
        .catch((error) => handleException(error));
});

    (async) createNewClient(options) → {Promise.<(Boolean|Object)>}

    Create a new client

    Source:
    • main.js, line 872
    Parameters:
    Name Type Description
    options Object
    Name Type Attributes Description
    name String
    tel String <optional>
    email String <optional>
    country String <optional>
    city String <optional>
    postal String <optional>
    adress String <optional>
    maxWeeklyHours String
    companyIDs Array
    contactIDs Array <optional>
    active String
    password String
    Throws:

    errors

    Type
    Error | *
    Returns:
    Type:
    Promise.<(Boolean|Object)>
    Example
    // Creates a new client and checks the returned data
// Can also be done using promises
try {
    const newClient = await createNewClient({
        name: $("#name").val(),
        maxWeeklyHours: $("#maxWeeklyHours").val(),
        companyIDs: $("#companyIDs").val(),
        active: $("input[name='active']:checked").val(),
        password: "super_secret_password"
    });

    if ($.isEmptyObject(newClient)) return;
    console.log(`New client created with the id: ${newClient.id}`);
} catch (e) {
    handleException(e);
}

    handleException(e)

    Handle errors

    Source:
    • main.js, line 659
    Parameters:
    Name Type Description
    e Error

    An error
    Example
    // Handle any error showing a message + adding it to the logs
try {
    // Something that throws
} catch (error) {
    handleException(error);
}

    (async) login(user, pass, attempts, type) → {Promise.<void>}

    Login

    Source:
    • main.js, line 492
    Parameters:
    Name Type Description
    user String

    The username
    pass String

    The password
    attempts Number

    Login attempts
    type String
    Throws:

    errors

    Type
    Error | *
    Returns:
    Type:
    Promise.<void>
    Example
    // Tries to login as test

// Using async/await
try {
    await login("test", "1234", 1);
} catch (error) {
    handleException(error);
}

// Using promises
login("test", "1234", 1)
    .catch((error) => handleException(error));

    Source:
    • main.js, line 771

    The company id
    client String

    The client id
    date String

    A specific date to jump to
    view Object

    The current fullcalendar view
    Example
    // Updates the calendar events for company with the id 1
updateCalendarEvents("1", null, null, $("#calendar").fullCalendar("getView"));
